Description: Body sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery band-cup with root of handle upper left; interior glazed black; exterior: two dilute loops from volutes of handle palmette and hind leg of probably a deer to right; handle area glazed below, glazed black zone above reserved area.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 408, no. B619)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0479) (Phase 1)
